Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, right on metro”
Reviews.Author: Premysl
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in San Giusto on a "Euroweekend" trip to Rome at the end of February 2012. The trip was a real bargain, it cost us about €180 for 3 days stay including flight tickets from Prague. The hotel is very conveniently located on Piazza Bologna with metro being only few steps from the hotel door. It gets three stops to get to Termini central hub, twenty minutes to reach Fontana di Trevi, half an hour to get to Vatican. Under the hotel there is a supermarket, what can be quite handy. San Giusto deserves its three stars, the only setback was the squeaking bed, it took a good concentration and carefully precise moves when turning on the bed not to wake the whole Rome in the middle of the night. Not even mentioning any other activities. The room we have occupied was small but neat and clean. It was extremely quiet, the only noise we heard during the three nights were our neighbours coming to their room through a corridor which was only once and no big deal. Even now, writing this review after the last night in the hotel, it's Monday morning and I can't hear a single sound. The breakfast is good, you get salami, mortadella, cheese, vegetables, fruits, two kinds of fruit juices, eggs, yoghurt and a few sweets to choose from. But it was rather cold in the breakfast room, so we had to wear sweaters for the breakfast. We were told by the receptionist that the check-out time is 09:30 which is quite soon for a hotel but I am not sure if this is their standard time of check-out or it was just set by the guy on the spot. Otherwise the staff was responsive, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I recomend”
Reviews.Author: Mariliava
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cosy, very big. If you are arriving in the airport take the cheapest train to tiburtina and then the metro line B. You can stop at station tiburtina instead of termini to go to this hotel. It is a problem that you have to climb with lugagge till 1st floor because only there the elevator starts. Also where they keep your lugagge when you check out is not a safe place. They should do domething about it. The hotel is not faced to piazza bologna. You have to turn a street and then find the hotel, but it it very near, only a bit dificult to find when you expect it to be facing the piazza. Despite all these the stay in this hotel was very agreable. Hot water, nice towels. The bed is a bit unconfortable, but nothing that will compromise your sleep. The breakfast could be better, but it was ok. Staff were ok. There is prepaid internet downstairs where you can even print stuff. and a reasonable wifi in teh room. I had a good experience so I recomend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: 12ASunderlands
Reviews.Content: This was not a good experience! I had not chosen this hotel but was sent there due to an overbooking error at its sister hotel. The beds were uncomfortable but the bathroom was clean. The room was at the front of the hotel which was soo noisy (even throughout the night). The lift only goes from the 1st floor so a struggle to get luggage to the room and you still have to navigate stairs all the way. Breakfast was poor. I would not recommend this as it certainly wasn't a budget hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Could do better!”
Reviews.Author: SandyWalesuk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel and the room they gave us smelt of smoke. so we asked to change it. They gave us another room which looked ok, but over the front of the hotel and road. After unpacking, we then found TV , Air Conditioning, didin't work. Bathroom had blocked shower drain, and no plugs in the bidet or sink. also the bathroom window was screwed shut. We obviously complained, they offered us another room, but this was poor and looked very well used and mucky. So we said we would stay in the room if they fixed everything. We arrived Sunday by Wednesday still nothing fixed. We had a shrug and sarcastic comment from the male receptionist, who couldn't care less. Eventually we spoke to the female manager who fixed the shower herself, and the rest was done next day. Apart from the air conditioning. Two other couples moved out-because their rooms were aweful! Some further bad points- The Hotel is over a supermarket, they start work at 6am so lots of noise. Market trader sets up around 7am outside the entrance. Two beggers next to Hotel entrance every day. The walls in the corridors are all scuffed and need painting. Breakfast OK but boring. Coffee aweful unless you pay extra for freshly made. The owners need to sort out the problems and attitude. I was assured of a nice room. If that was a nice room I would hate to stay in the worst! I would rate as a two star. Beds are foldups. pillows dirty. Look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Would come back!!”
Reviews.Author: shoeghirl
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel late at night and checked in no problems, rooms were clean and tidy bathrooms were lovely had no problems with water etc, fridge in room was great, beds were comfy and cleaned on a daily basis and fresh clean towels provided every day, breakfast was served in dining room from 7am till 10am everyday and was more than adequate, Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and there is a supermarket right under hotel for anything else you require...... I dont understand why some people choose to complain about the San Giusto on this as we would definately come back again..

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: pindakaas020
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this place! It is really run down a real budget accommodation, 2 stars at the most! See the photo's they speak for themselves. The bed's are basic stretchers, the minibar is a run down (dirty) fridge. The shower has to run for 10 minutes for some "hot" water.

Reviews.Title: “Lemonade hotel, lemonade price!”
Reviews.Author: Xenawarriorteacher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money and offers an excellent breakfast, and is easily accessible by bus and metro. The room is basic but comfy. We found most of the staff to be helpful. We realised that for the lemonade price we paid for our room,we could not expect champagne services and facilities! Some things can be inconvenient to cope with. The lift does not begin on the ground floor - after lugging heavy suitcases up and down metro stairs, it was hard to do it yet again inside the hotel. The air con is operated by flipping a 'trip' switch on a wall panel. Not easy to work out! Metro Line B and bus number 62 take you right into Piazza Bologna (however, #62 does not call at Termini). We struggled to find the hotel, so here are some tips. The hotel is not actually on the Piazza, so don't look for it there! It is also not visibly signposted from the piazza as the San Giusto sign faces down the road away from the piazza. The best help I can give with directions is to say that the hotel is close to the gelateria, which is on the piazza. Go down the road off the piazza where you see the green sign indicating a supermarket as the hotel is right alongside that. If you see a sign for Hotel Laura, then you are one street too far along - go down the street parallel to that. We didn't see any road signs, which didn't help.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: gsbchitown
Reviews.Content: The best thing the Hotel San Giusto has going for it is its relatively convenient location. It is just steps from Metro line A, which runs directly to Termini station, the Colosseo and Circus Maximus. There is also a full-service supermarket (with a fantastic bakery and deli) just outside the hotel entrance, which was great for picking up snacks and bottled water. Now the bad stuff. The room was TINY and very difficult to move around in, and while it had an ensuite bathroom with shower, it took over 5 minutes for the shower water to warm up. The room did have a private air-conditioner, which worked well. The cable tv is all Italian tv stations, with the exception of CNN in English. There was a good-sized fridge in the room, with plenty of room for non-mini-bar items. The room was not very clean -- it had a musty smell and every day, the maid left the windows open to air out the room. We had problems at the very beginning with the Hotel San Giusto, which were sort-of fixed, but it was very frustrating. When I booked the room, I made sure to reserve a double-bed room. And my reservation stated on its face that it was a double bed room reservation. When I called to confirm, the hotel clerk said that it was a single twin bed room! After much arguing with the clerk, I thought it was resolved. Until I got there, and they told me that it was a 2 twin bed room, not the double bed room I had booked. Also, despite the fact that reservation states that check-in is at 1:00pm, they will not let you check-in until 2:30pm, which was a huge hassle. Every day there were guests in the lobby waiting to be able to check-in. The breakfast provided is plentiful, but average. They have bread, cold-cuts, cheese, sweet rolls, juice and coffee (often cold). Tables were often not re-set after earlier diners had eaten breakfast. While the location was convenient, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good budget hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tony_orrell
Reviews.Content: As frequent visitors to Rome, my wife and I have just returned from another trip having stayed at the San Giusto for the 3rd time. Our last stay was over 5 years ago and I must admit that having read some of the bad reviews on this site, I was concerned that the hotel had changed during that period. I need not have worried. We were also accompanied by our friends and when we arrived we were given two very comfortable rooms on the 4th floor. The rooms were clean and were cleaned daily. They had Air-Conditioning units and we kept our room at a very comfortable 21C throughout our 7-day stay whilst the Roman temperature soared to 32C by the end of the week. The double glazed French windows and the outside shutters kept the noise levels from the street to a minimum and therefore sleeping was not a problem. Some of the staff at the hotel can be a little curt and this may come across as being rude to some guests, however I personally think that this may just be a "city phenomena" which I have also experienced in Paris and in my own hometown, London. Having said that, there is a charming gentleman receptionist called Fabio who is was extremely helpful and very friendly to us. The San Giusto also provides a wonderful breakfast each day (from 7am to 10 am) in a clean and airy breakfast room. The lovely Signora who lays out the breakfast and makes tea and coffee for the guests, constantly replenishes any items that may have run out (even towards the end of service) She is another member of the team who is always polite and helpful to her guests. The breakfast buffet consists of cold meats; cheese; bread; yoghurt; eggs; cereal; fruit juice; fruit cocktail and the most wonderful cakes (cornetti). My only complaint about the hotel is that there is no lift until you reach the 1st floor. We were offered the services of a bell boy but we managed to carry our cases to the 1st floor as the stairs are not steep. The corridors were always very hot on our floor but there were windows that could be open if needed. When I return to Rome again I will have no hesitation in booking a stay at the San Giusto again. Piazza Bologna is a heavily populated area, as is Rome in general but it is a nicer than the area around Termini where there are many other hotels. P. Bologna has quite a few restaurants, pizzerias and cafes nearby, so there are never a shortage of places to eat. The metro is very handy for getting into the centre and there are many bus routes which pass through the area. (However both the metro and buses get very busy so personal security must be a priority at all times)

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, nice and clean!”
Reviews.Author: ImraanK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several nights while on a tour of Italy. It is well situated in Rome, right near the subway station. There is great food just a short walk away, in almost every direction you go. The room was frequently cleaned, and well maintained. One warning, the elevator is only accessible from the second floor and up, which means that you have to carry your luggage up a flight of stairs before you can reach it! That could be difficult for some people... There is a nice terrace on the 4th or 5th floor that has some outdoor seating, and there is also some space on the roof of the building (accessible via elevator). Overall, a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “you can really do better than this substandard place for your money”
Reviews.Author: hyperreal
Reviews.Content: On first entering the lobby there is a distinct smell of damp - it's an old building and renovation is patchy in places. If you like 60s decor then this is the place for you. The shower in the room didn't work properly - we had to wait 5 minutes for hot water to arrive and the cubicle didn't drain immediately. The room wasquite shabby with 60s bedspreads and as it was at the back of the hotel with a depressing view of tenements / pigeon droppings / cigarette butts down below. The door to the bedroom was slightly off its hinges with evidence of a botched diy job as an attempt at repair. Breakfast was really nothing special - no hotplate for coffee / hot water just one of those awful machines. Mini bar / fridge in room had some black mould - yuk We did have some drinks on first night and made a really careful note of what we'd used so I was really annoyed when I went to settle that they'd calculated slightly differently from us - I know it's just a couple of euros but it just seemed to sum up the place. This is also the only hotel I've ever been to where they make you settle up in advance - now I can see why. Staff are superficially polite but the thin veneer rubs off if you interrupt them at the wrong time or dare to complain about anything My advice is shop around - there must be better than this for your money.

Reviews.Title: “The worest hotel I stayed!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ukgloria
Reviews.Content: The room is small and very dirty. I can feel the dust on the table! also the carpet is very dirty with some dirty water. The air-conditioner was not working!!!! How to stay in Rome in summer with out air-conditioner, we argued with hotel, however, they rejected with very rude attitude. All these are not the large problem. The largest problem is that in the room, the ghost exits...I can really not belive what I experienced. When I was sleeping, the whole room shaked just like earthquake. At that time I though it was earthquake maybe and continued to sleep, however, it shaked again. i could not sleep anymore and went down with my bf and stayed the night in the lobby. The service person in the hotel said they did not have any spare room so we had to stay in the lobby. What a rubbish hotel.!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd read reviews first!!!”
Reviews.Author: tattoolady13
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old daughter and I stayed here for her graduation trip while in Rome. The night we arrived we were greeted by the moldy smell of the lobby and the smell of cigarette smoke everywhere in the hotel. The elevator wasn't working so we had to lug our suitcases up 2 flights of stairs and nothing but the lobby was air conditioned. The room was clean enough but the air didn't work very well. I brought this up to the night desk clerk and he was extremely rude and said " just turn it on and it will work"! We got absolutely nowhere with him the entire time we were there. We actually observed him get quite angry with a guest because she was asking for directions to a restaraunt and he told her he didn't have time to help her and she was taking up to much of his time. We did get some help from the day clerk who gave us some direction and answered our questions. The water pressure in the shower was terrible, the selection of breakfast food was quite odd. It was very hot while we were there and the maid would turn the air off everyday while we were out so the room would be quite hot every time we returned. The only good thing about this hotel was the location to the metro and the Gelatoria that was about 3 blocks away. I would NEVER stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: diytours
Reviews.Content: Very near bologna metro stop, easy to get to. Take the Metro B line towards Rebiba and get off at Bologna, tickets cost 1 euro per trip and can be bought at the station. The hotel is just a short walk from Bologna metro, it's in a residential area rather than the main city centre which probably accounted for the price, 90 euros for a double room, saying that though there is easy access to the main sights using the metro service. There were some small bars and restaurants nearby, not a great selection but enough to get by on. The reception staff were very friendly and welcoming and our room (No.3) although basic was perfectly adequate, there was a good size fridge and air con. The sheets were lovely and crisply clean and the towels were large and fluffy! Breakfast was continental style, good selection of pastries, meat, cheese, yogurt etc, nicely laid out and no problem with the coffee machine.

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket”
Reviews.Author: viajer0123
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an excellent location, almost opposite an exit to the metro station, which allowed one to rapidly get anywhere in Rome. It was also almost next-door to a mini-supermarket, and there was a variety of (overpriced) restaurants, including a kosher one, nearby. It was also located opposite a pasticceria-gelateria which did gorgeous ice-creams. The area was clearly run-down, with graffiti in the piazza and some derelict shops, but it felt perfectly safe. The hotel was slightly Fawlty Towers-esque in that there were only 2 main members of staff and the cleaning lady doubled up as the waitress for breakfast. Although small, the room was well-appointed with TV and a remote-controlled air-conditioner so powerful that the room felt like a fridge when it was 30 degrees outside. It had a marble ensuite bathroom with a powerful shower. The staff were friendly and my only problem was the flat batteries in the TV remote, which they replaced. Breakfast was perfectly adequate and consisted of jam-filled pastries (not really to my taste), brioche, cheese, and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here ONLY if you don't wanna spend too much...”
Reviews.Author: Bora_Lagoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty cheap, in comparison to others 3 stars hotels in Rome, and despite being quite far from 'downton' is well connected to it due to the subway and the buses stations nearby. And that's it for the good news. Let's see the bad news... The rooms are the smallest I've ever seen: if you have a large suitcase the front door won't open. The closet is small, smelly and dirt, as well as the carpet (also very worn) and the walls (full of scratches and dark marks). The bathroom was appalling: the window didn't close well, there's only one radiator and so I assume that the room would be very cold in winter; the basin is missing the bottom lid and when I came back after the morning 'cleaning' the roommaid let my eye conctat lenses closing lid fall into the basin's hole! The shower is dirt and very old and the courtesy set consisted only in a sample of shampoo and a small soap. The bed is quite comfy but either the sheets and the blanket were dirty!! The so called buffet breakfast was miserable: a few pastries and very cheap salami and sliced chees. The orange juice was mixed with water, and the first morning the waitress told us that the cappucino machine was broken, so she brought a cup of cheap coffee and not so fresh milk. No cereals and the tablecloth was stained and full of bread crumbles from the morning before! Also, there is no elevator to the first floor, and so every guest had to bring its luggage upstairs by himself!!!!!!! Plus, we had to do the check out on the spot as we arrived, and pay in advance!!!! Please don't stay here and in the others hotels of the same Leonardi's chain, as they seem to be pretty and comfortble but they aren't. It's so clear that the only thing the owner has in mind is to maximise his profits, and he doesn't care at all of the weelbeing of his guests!

Reviews.Title: “worst chioce”
Reviews.Author: IspartaRoman
Reviews.Content: It was the fault of my life selecting San Giusto Hotel. It was a central hotel but that is all. The elevator is not in the entrance you have to climb long stairs to reach it. The room is very small, every door in the room includes the door of the wardrobe does not function well and noisy. The bath was terrific; toilet siphon was out of function, the shower handle was broken, not mounted on the wall, it was on the floor. We warned the staff about the problems, nothing has changed. Breakfast includes nothing, it is disgusting. While we were leaving the hotel, they demonstrated their real attitude to their clients, behaved very agressive. I recommend any hotel in Rome but not San Giusto...

Reviews.Title: “not the worst ive been to”
Reviews.Author: loopylou86
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at another hotel and were moved to this one due to electrical works. The hotel was clean and tidy but very basic. It does not have its own restaurant (only for breakfast) and I was petrified of the lifts. Not very good for those with children in pushchairs or those in wheel chairs as to get to the lift u have to use the stairs and once inside the lift it feels as if it will break. I also found the room quite noisy as we were on the side near the road and the italians seem to hoot there horns for no apparent reason. It was a 2 minute walk from the mstro station which was handy as we used it to get everywhere. I probably wouldnt return to rome as once you've done it you've done it but if i did and was on a budget i would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the San Giusto at the end of our month long sojourn in Italy. It wasn't the worst of the hotels we stayed in (not by far) but it wasn't the best either. The front desk staff was dismal, not rude but not personable either. The rooms were tiny but clean. We had problems with the electricity going off and got rather used to showering and eating in the dark, romantic no! Although the hotel is not centrally located it is easy to find and close to the metro. There are several resturaunts within walking distance with good food at reasonable prices. The breakfasts were fresh and the service excellent. Although there is an elevator it is only accessable after you climb a flight of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I searched on expedia for a package that was affodable and the hotel to have a decent star rating and low and behold I came across Hotel San Giusto. As my husband and I compared the different hotels in Rome this one seemed to be our best choice, given the price range we were looking at. Upon our arrival at the hotel we were greeted with the aroma of cigarettes, stained couches and the most pleasant concierge in Italy, not! I'd never met someone so expressionless in my life! After checking in, my husband had to carry our 5 piece luggage up a spiral staircase by himself. Where was the bell boy? Do they know what a bell boy is? We made it to our room, which was clean but old and very dark. The bathroom was clean with a large window, I think it was the brighest room in the hotel, I didn't pay money to give the locals a peep show! The shower itself was super smallI and in order to get hot water you had to let it run 5-10 minutes. The drainage in the shower was not good, we needed to keep an eye on the water to ensure it would go over the divider. At times while showering we would have to shut off the water and let the water drain out, to put the shower on again. As far as the bed, it sunk into the middle and the A/C, we had no idea how to control it and how in the world could I forget about the Madonna over our bed. The following morning we woke up to enjoy the continental breakfast offered. I'll give them credit, it wasn't bad, they had cold cuts, cereal, fruits, etc..except that they seemed to serve the same thing day in and day out, ever heard of variation! How about eggs, pankcakes, waffles, etc.....Oh, and how could I forget the aroma of cigarettes, delightful early in the morning. Don't plan to sleep in and expect privacy in the hotel either. You can hear everything that goes on in the hallway and other rooms and if you haven't given your key to the front desk by a certain time in the morning the reception calls you constantly to find out when you'll be turning your key in to have the room cleaned. And if you are planning on staying in a bit later, expect an attendant to come knocking on your door needing to check the refrigerator for usage, who cares if your in bed in your PJ's! After a few days at the hotel, my husband and I realized that the cleaning crew were not changing our sheets, they were just making the bed. We tested our hypothesis by marking the pillowcase only to find the same case on the pillow everyday of our stay (We stayed 2 weeks). Our towels were also just re-hunged and re-folded. Unexpected Charges: You want them to hold your passport in the reception area, expect to pay. You need them to call a taxi, expect to pay. It seemed as if you needed any help from any one of the empoyees, expect to pay. As far as the location of the hotel, the metro was around the corner, a grocery store downstairs, there was a bank around the corner, a pharmacy was nereby, there were approximately 2 bars walking distance (one which stayed open late) and 2 great little restaurants nearby. The area was fairly quiet, except for the occassional siren or ambulance but thats just like any other city. I only hope that I can make your decision easier. You've been warned, advised, cautioned, by staying there you go at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but bearable”
Reviews.Author: RLS1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Giusto Hotel for 3 nights hoping for a romantic break in Rome. Rome is a lovely city - it's a shame the same can't be said for this hotel! Don't get me wrong, the hotel isn't absolutely horrendous, but there is no way that it should be rated 3 stars. The exterior of the hotel looked shabby, but I didn't let that put me off ... and first impressions of our room were pretty good too. However, it soon became apparent that the window in the room had been opened prior to our arrival due to the fact that the room reeked of damp. The reason for this soon became clear when I took a shower - the cubicle doors didn't shut properly, so water flooded the bathroom floor and seeped into the carpet. I tried to open the wardrobe and the door fell off its hinges, and I then tried to open the dresser draw which collapsed! I have to say, we found it quite comical, it was a bit like Fawlty Towers. The last straw came when our electricity failed twice while we were getting ready to go out - we nearly missed our tour as a consequence. It's not all bad though - the room appeared clean and the bed was comfortable. The maids cleaned the room every day and changed any towels that we left on the floor. We also found the breakfast to be very good (continental - bread, cold meats, eggs, cereal, fruit etc). The mini bar drinks were priced quite cheaply. The location of the hotel is fine - just 10 mins on the tube to the Colosseum. Yes, the area it's in does have a lot of graffiti, but so does most of Rome. We had a fabulous time in Rome and didn't let the hotel ruin it for us. I would highly recommend the company Discover Rome Tours which has English speaking tour guides - their tours were informative but light hearted. All in all, I wouldn't recommend that you book a room in this hotel. If you've already booked, however, I wouldn't worry - as long as you've got a sense of humour it's bearable!

Reviews.Title: “San Giusto - good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I returned from Rome a week ago. We stayed in San Giusto. Before that I read many reviews and was a bit confussed since they gave such a different impression of the hotel. I myself was very happy with the San Giusto. The price was very good (last minute) - we paid EUR 335 for five nights for a double room. The hotel was nice and in a very good location. It takes about 7 -10 min by metro to go to main places in the centre of Rome. Breakfast was lovely, good selection of food, pleasant environment. Receptionsts were friendly (except the older man who was just doing his work - no complains about him) and smiling. The room was a bit small and, I should mention, not very clean (dust and some small things under beds or on the closet) but overall it was pretty good and had everything that's needed. I would hardly recommend to go there and will probably chose it again if I go to Rome next time.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, but not central”
Reviews.Author: bumbleb
Reviews.Content: well, as always, you get what you pay for... the room and hotel itself was better than I expected for a 3 star in a european big city, its was very clean and nice overall, and the breakfast was indeed plentiful (if you don't get sick of meat)... but its not very convenient. The metro is just around the corner, but you have to take it to get to the sites of rome, whcih means its hard to return to the hotel for a little break and then go out again. we were forced to take a $20 taxi home each night becasue the italian restaurants are open only very late for dinner (usually our dinner ended around 10 to 11 pm) and the metro closes early (although no one really could tell us when it closed). but at least the taxi's were easy to flag down and good for our lazy bones at the end of full walking days in cold december. most of the concierges were surly and less than helpful, but I blame mr. bush not the concierges. in fact we found the italians to have a general dislike for americans... not as friendly as I remember it on my last visit 7 years ago. one bit of general advice: the train from termini station back to the airport may be 1/2 hour on extraordinary days but it took us 2 hours from hotel door to airport door... which meant the check-in counter was closed by the time we got to the airport (we still had 1 whole hour till the scheduled take-off) and the italian agents were completely unwilling to provide any alternative options. no kidding, they told us we were 4 minutes late and we should know better, as they all walked off chatting with each other... I think maybe they were late for their own lunch. we ending up flying out to london, staying for a couple days till we could find a cheap flight back to NYC. all in all, i won't return to italy for awhile, no matter how spectacular the architecture is. but that said, Hotel San Giusto is clean and comfortable overall, and worth it if you get in in a package (discount) price.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.......”
Reviews.Author: Pauline_H
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK - but I can't get more excited about it than that. We stayed in a triple room and the 3rd bed was a pull out - comfy enough for a few nights, but maybe not if you had a bad back. The room was pretty small so it was a bit cramped. The bathroom was clean and the breakfast was OK (on until 10am which was good). When we arrived, the bedside tables looked like they hadn't been dusted for a good while and the electricity fused twice, so they had to send the porter up to fix it. The review says the hotel is 1km from the Trevi and the Spanish Steps - maybe as the crow flies!!! The San Giusto is literally a minute from the Metro which is handy so it doesn't feel a million miles out, but it's a bit too far to come back and get changed for dinner if you have been out all day. we got taxis back and they cost about 10 Euros. A word of warning - the lift doesn't come to the ground floor - you have to walk up a couple of flights of stairs to get it; which might make it a bit of a problem for the less able or those with big suitcases! All in all, for £33 per night, it's reasonable, but I wouldn't stay there again. I would challenge the 3 star rating though....

Reviews.Title: “A decent place”
Reviews.Author: M&JTravel
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Rome and spent 3 evenings at Hotel San Guisto. We travelled with our friends. We admit, their room had an unusual door that appeared very unsecure, however, overall, the rooms were clean, affordable and convenient. The location was great, as it was around the corner from the Bologna metro station (line B), and also is at the end of bus line 62 (useful info, as metro line A closes at 9:30pm). We would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Miami_Mom_28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our first trip to Rome January 2005, we were greeted at the airport by a wonderful driver, (we booked our hotel transfers through expedia) He gave us a lot of helpful tips. When we got to the hotel, our room was not ready, we were told it would be ready in an hour so we went out for a walk, It's not the most scenic area but the metro station is very close. When we got back to the hotel our room was ready and someone took our luggage for us and showed us to our room, its true about the elevator, it's on the third floor (no idea why) but if you have a problem walking up two flights of stairs then you're not going to make it in Rome anyway because there are stairs EVERYWHERE. The room was small but had everything we needed, the streets were noisy and an ambulance would speed by every couple of minutes, but to tell you the truth it didnt bother me at all, it was all part of the experience. The room was very clean, the bathroom was also very clean, the shower is pretty small. we were without hot water one morning, but when we got back to the hotel in the afternoon the problem had been fixed. The continental breakfast was delicious! definitely not what I expected for such an affordable price and the staff was very friendly. There is also a supermarket right next door to the hotel. I would definitely go back to this hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from visiting Rome for the first time and I dare say it could be the last. Having paid £160 for 3 nights in a twin room we weren't expecting too much and boy were we right !! We arrived at the San Giusto hotel at 1.00pm exhausted having been travelling since 5.00am and were very anxious to get checked into our room. We were greeted with a luke warm reception (not even a hello, welkommen or a bonjour) only to discover that we had been allocated a double room, as opposed to the twin room we had booked and paid for, well in advance. After going back to the reception and explaining this, we were begrudgingly given a twin room on the 3rd floor. We had to carry our own cases up two flights of stairs to the first floor where the lift was located (a bizarre set up if ever I saw one) and went up to the room. Inside, it did indeed have twin beds but these were seperated off by a filthy wall partition accompanied by damp peeling wallpaper and almost threadbare carpets. The room was very dark and there was also an unbearable smell lurking everywhere in the hotel. We lugged our cases back to the reception and explained that the room was totally unacceptable. We were then allocated another room on the 2nd floor (up we went again with our cases) to find that we had been given another double room. We trudged back to the reception for the third time and after looking at 4 different rooms in total, we decided to stick with the last one as it seemed to be the best kept out of the lot and even that wasn't great but we hoped to be spending as little time in the room/hotel as possible. The bathroom was small but clean, as was the bed linen. The air conditioning was a very dated unit on the wall which did eventually work but was programmed not to go below 20 degrees. The wallpaper was peeling and the carpet looked as though it had been fitted by a partially sighted donkey ! Deciding to leave the room within the first half an hour, we went and explored the area around the hotel. What an absolute --------, nothing but rubbish strewn streets and buildings and shops full of grafitti. There were a few small cafe's dotted about and a supermarket round the side of the hotel which actually seemed ok. Bologna metro station was about 50 metres away which was handy - but it was definitely a badly cared for area. During our 3 day stay we visited lots of the main sights (apart from St Peters and the Sistene chapel which was not open on Sundays) and endured one poor meal after the other. We tried eating in lots of different areas but found nothing that actually tasted traditional/authentic or even nice, for that matter. I expected to be sampling delicious breads, cheeses and olives etc but found nothing of the sort. The closest thing we got to this was a basket of dry stale bread with one of the meals. I even tried the italian antipasti which was a plate containing a cheese slice, 2 dried up slices of salami and only 2 olives on that weren't even pitted ! We found the ice creams to be ok but again, nothing like I expected considering we were in Italy. Feeling very disapponted with the hotel, the food and even the italians (who appeared impatient and often rude) we prepared for our departure home. The night before we left, we asked the attendant on reception at San Giusto if he would be kind enough to book us a taxi to Ciampino airport early the following morning. He agreed and said that as we needed to be at the airport for 8.00am (and that the journey would take no longer than 25 minutes) a pick up of 7.30am would be sufficient and that we could have breakfast in the restaurant room at 7.00am before the taxi arrived. We were happy enough with this and actually felt quite pleased that at least one member of the hotel had succeeded in being helpful - HOW WRONG WE WERE !!! We were up and out of our room at 7.00am on the dot and arrived in reception to hand our keys in and attempt the breakfast that we had missed the previous 2 days. It was a different attendant on reception and when we explained that we were going for breakfast like they suggested, the attendant told us that breakfast was not available until 7.30am on Sundays (which completely contradicted the other attendant from the night before). Feeling frustrated after debating with the attendant what we had been previously told, we had no choice but to sit and wait the remaining 30 minutes until 7.30am for the taxi (without breakfast). Of course, 30 minutes came and went and no taxi arrived and when it reached 7.40am we asked the attendant to call the taxi firm and check on it's whereabouts. The attendant did this and discovered that no such taxi had even been booked by the previous attendant. Confused, we asked what was going on and the attendant assured us that he had now booked one and that it would arrive within 15 minutes. At this point we decided to quickly go up to the breakfast room just for a drink and a roll. We went in for the first time to find the set up of the room to be quite inviting and saw that a lady was filling up the juice containers, but again, no acknowledgement or greeting. We looked along the food table where there was a choice of only 2 pastries (both sweet), a plate of salami, ham and a plate of cheese slices next to a basket of unhealthy looking boiled eggs. Giving the small selection of food a miss, we picked up a glass for some juice to discover that they were absolutely filthy. We went through 6 different glasses until we found one that looked like it had actually been washed, quickly had some juice and hurried back to the reception. With the taxi still on its way (by now it's 7.55am) and leaving our cases in reception, we decided to walk to the end of the road to the cash machines. We were back within 5 minutes and the reception attendant said he had cancelled our taxi. Absolutely furious, we asked why and he replied "how am I supposed to know where you were going, if you are not here when the taxi arrives then we have to pay 50 euros" I then said "you can see our suitcases are here, we only went to the bank for a few minutes" and he just ignorantly shrugged his shoulders. We were absolutey furious, but I decided that after staying in a complete dump, experiencing so many problems and being treated terribly, I knew standing there shouting and arguing would get us nowhere, so we had to grit our teeth and silently admit defeat. We snatched our cases and stomped out of the hotel mumbling obscenities along the way. We hurried towards the metro station in fear of missing our flight. However, despite the problems we had and the overall disappointment with the food and hotel, we were actually still glad we visited Rome. The sights were enjoyabe and the weather was gloriously hot. But as for staying in this pathetic apology for a 3 star hotel - YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED !!!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't do it again!”
Reviews.Author: aschilson
Reviews.Content: My sister and I used hotwire and got a reservation for this hotel June 10-13 and June 24. The price was great for Rome at $105/night in busy season. The location is not in the middle of things, but very conveniently located near a metro stop, so it's easy to get anywhere for 1 euro. The metro closes before midnight, so take late night taxi costs into consideration. Someone else recommended the restaurant Il Tunel (walkable) which was wonderful. Our first stay we had a hard time finding the hotel as it's not exactly in the piazza, but the locals were helpful. It's a real neighborhood with people selling things on the street and the ever present Rome graffiti. The reception lobby is nice enough, but another client was having issues with the reception when we arrived. There is no elevator at this level, but a charming bellboy brought our bags up. He took us to a room with one big bed. I'd requested 2 small beds and they switched us immediately. While settling in, the electricity went out in our room. The bellboy fixed it. It went out again. He fixed it again. He was friendly and we were all laughing, probably from jetlag, but this could be really annoying. After that, our stay was fine. Not luxurious by any means, hard bed, plain room... but nice breakfast and service. A solid bargain. Our second stay, we had a room reservation and 2 girlfriends had another room reservation. All confirmed and prepaid to hotwire. Well, on arrival we were told that they only had one room and me and my sister would be transferred to a hotel near termini, right where we'd just come from. My sister heard something about a water problem in part of the building, but I think they oversold the rooms. I STRONGLY emphasized to the manager that the four of us must be together on our last night in Italy since we'd flown from all over for this reunion. Eventually he talked the other hotel into taking all of us and they paid a taxi to take us there (realise we lost 2 or 3 valuable hours in Rome). At Hotel Fiamma the desk man from Belgium and his assistant that day were kind and tried their best to accomodate us, but my sister and I were given a room with one SMALL bed slightly bigger than a twin bed and our girlfriends were given a room without functioning air conditioning. We stayed out most of the night and left for the US very early the next day, but our friends ended up switching hotel rooms three times and said everyone, but the Belgian desk man, was terrible to them. If I had to do it over again, I'd avoid Hotwire because once you pay, not only can you not get your money back easily, you lose control and don't have bargaining power with your hotel. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “OK value for the money”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller68
Reviews.Content: I can't complain too much about San Giusto because it was cheap in comparison to other hotels in Rome. However, because it was cheap, you can't expect to have luxury service or big rooms. In comparison to other 3-star hotels in Italy, SG was more like 2.5 star. But they're in Rome after all. The location is convenient if you're planning on taking the Metro everywhere in Rome. Although you need to be mindful of the fact that the Metro closes around midnight (as I found out when I was trying to catch the Metro back from the Coliseum). Since I was in Rome for an overnight stay, and also because I didn't stay in the hotel for very long, I thought the San Giusto was fine. Also, I found the service at the front reception to be courteous -- something that you don't always find in other hotels in Italy (although to be fair, I read in the other reviews that the courtesy is inconsistent). So to sum it all up, if you're don't have high expectations, and aren't going to stay in your hotel room for long periods of time, and are looking for a good value, I think San Giusto would suit you just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: Brandie13
Reviews.Content: There is no way this is a 3 star hotel. There wasn't even tissue or soap. The rooms are very tiny of course, the AC is ancient but did work. There are no plugs, they're so ancient you can't use them. Rotary dial phone, you can't use. The staff was friendly enough but not helpful or able to put through a phone call. I would not stay here again, the room was not dirty but it could have been a lot cleaner. On the last night we switched to a hotel called Imperio located next to Termini station which is better and less expensive. We paid 75 euro per night there but San Giusto was about 125euro - RIP OFF!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: fesp29
Reviews.Content: If you value your life, stay away. This hotel is a fire trap. The rooms have no smoke detectors nor window fire escapes. The wooden shutters do not open. If you are handicap, stay away. The elevator is on the first floor, not the ground floor where you check in. You must climb a combination of two stare cases and walk down a narrow hallway to reach the elevator. The attendants are Rude. The hotel is located in a "ugly" "dirty" area of the city. The room is small, as expected in Rome, with 2 twin beds. The bedspreads were dull/dingy and appeared dirty. The service people will knock and enter, without any consideration, just to check the in-room bar. The good: Bathroom was clean. Large towels, in-room bar prices are cheap. PS.. Hotwire customers beware. Like a blind date, this hotel is not a pretty site. Thank God I only stayed for a weekend, 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Confusion and incompetence”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went there with a group of 25+ people for the 2005 Rome Marathon. Upon arrival, we were told by the people at the lobby that our confirmed reservation for rooms with 3 beds could not be honored because "rooms are small" (weren't they so when they confirmed the reservation ?), and would be replaced with double+single rooms, and the rooms with double beds (we had some couples with young kids) really had two separate beds, and the cribs were not available. In the meantime, the same people addressed not very politely some other customers coming down of their room, telling them that they should't have got the room because they did not have a reservation (according to the customers they did, and they even had a confirmation fax) and they were just lucky not to be sent out because there was a spare room. At night after entering the room we discovered that the alleged' single rooms were actually fitted with double beds and quite large to accommodate the extra bed. In fact, in the end they gave us for the same price one more room than what we actually needed, but after trying a bit to return the room (we were not asking any discount, it was just for a courtesy to the hotel because we did not need it) we gave up given the difficulty in making them understand the issue. I doubt language problems as we were all italians. Second surprise after dinner -- we explicitly asked, in the reservation, breakfast at 7am or before given the race started early. After dinner, we were told by another waiter that on sundays breakfast could not be available before 7.30, that it was difficult to contact the director given that it was saturday 9pm to ask permission to the waitress to start at 7am. Again, after lengthy discussions we gave up and some of us bought our own breakfast, just to discover the next morning that well before 7am the room was already open, and a bunch of other foreign tourists were happily having their breakfast without the management caring to clear the confusion with us. Other than that the hotel is clean and well positioned, but we really had the impression that all the people at the lobby were completely disconnected from reality and had absolute no interest in addressing the customers' requests, not even those already confirmed by the hotel itself in the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here”
Reviews.Author: SKgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Rome yesterday and spent 4 nights at this hotel. If you plan on spending your vacation touring Rome, and want a clean, safe, inexpensive place to spend the night this hotel if for you. If you're expecting concierge service, 5 star meals, valet parking, etc. etc, then I'd suggest you spend a lot more and stay somewhere else. Location: 3 stops away from Termini and only a few more away from Colleseo. (Colleseum). The hotel is just outside the BOLOGNA station, at Piazza Bologna. I agree with others, it can be a bit confusing, but look for the Banca Incantessa- it's down that street on your left side. There's quite a few flags hanging above the door. The hotel is NOT facing the Piazza, so take your time to walk around and look down each street if you happen to find yourself disoriented upon leaving the subway station. One reviewer wrote that there's a "small" grocery store next door- it's actually like a supermarket- like our Safeways, IGA, Loebs, Piggy Wiggly's or an A &P. Just down across the street is an "American" (that's what it's called) pastry and espresso shop. The desserts in there are amazing! As well, just down Via Ravenna (one of the streets off the Piazza), there's a shop called UPIM- it's like a Zellers or small Target store, so if you're looking for extra toiletries, or some warmer socks, it's a great place to find some bargains. For directions to a really great restaurant highlighted in "LET'S GO ROME", please see bottom of this review. Highlights of this hotel- Internet access- 5 Euros for 30 minutes Breakfast- meats, cheeses, pastry, cereal, fruit, coffee, juice, breads- open from 6:10 to 10:30 (you can sleep in and still get free breakfast!!) Safety deposit boxes All rooms cleaned daily In-room refridgerators Television- while mainly Italian channels, there was CNN and MTV Hot showers with good water pressure! Great location Quiet, safe piazza All employees speak english and were extremely nice. If you want good service, you have to be pleasant yourself- seems to apply anywhere. You can securely leave your bags at the hotel if you arrive early and can't check in, or if you have to check out, but aren't ready to take your bags with you. Tours with Green Line can be arranged for you at the hotel. Downside- there is an elevator, but only once you've walked up two flights of stairs. Not a problem for most, but if you have mobility issues, this may present a problem. May be a downfall for some- piazza is quiet, so if you're looking for a party or a rowdy bar, this area isn't for you. We had a great time here- we were in Rome...how can it not be great? If you're just looking for a comfortable, clean, good quality bed, then you should stay here. Restaurant Il Tunnel: From the Piazza, walk down Vle. della Provincie Take the fourth right onto V. Padova Take your second left onto V. Arezzo It's at 11 V. Arezzo. The portions are HUGE, so don't feel you need to order all courses. The pizza only is probably the same as a North American large size. It's open from 7pm to midnight. Great food, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel as a base camp, Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Becks0_12
Reviews.Content: The 3 of stayed at San giusto 19 - 23 Feb 2005 ( 1 single, 1 Double) We arrived quite late (10pm) to be greeted at the front desk by a man from California, USA (We were very suprised). He was pleasant and we were in our room within minutes (You Take you own bags up one flight of staires to small lift, or you can continue walking up staires to different floors - 4 floors levels in total) First immpressions of the Hotel were good altough it does smell of cigar smoke throughout! The Rooms in general are small but to be honest they are absolutley fine if your not planning to spend a lot of time in them, which we didn't!! They are also carpeted throughout, which is nice in winter. The single room had a comfortable bed and it was clean with a small bathroom including shower, sink, toilet. The decoration is of good standard and the rooms were warm. Tv included. (It was freezing in Rome, Snow on the last day). Towels replaced daily. The Double room again is small (you couldn't walk down the left hand side of the bed because it was so close to the wall). It was warm and clean, although the maid didn't come in and do our room on one of the days. The bathroom was bright, fully tilled, had a shower, bidet, sink and toilet. There was plenty of hot water, even at midnight but it has a twist handle shower and if you push it the wrong way you'll be very cold - it takes a couple of minutes to heat up so don't jump in straight away. Tv had quite a few channels and some were in english. The Breakfast room (No restaurant) was large and in two parts. It is bright and clean but basic. It is located on the first floor and buffet breakfast is served from 7.30-10am. Breakfast was good - perfect to set you up for the day sightseeing in Rome but dont expect an american style spead! Breafast included many many pastries, even donunts.....a large basket of bread. Butter and a vast selection of jams. Cheese, 3 types of meat.... like ham etc. a bit of fruit limited cereals and Boiled eggs. Stay away from the coffee - yuk, it is hot but you can also request tea. Best time is about 8.30 - 9am. The buffet is re-filled frequently. The area of the hotel when first arriving looked a bit dodgy as there is grafiti but to be honest most areas of Rome have it. The surrounding area is safe and absolutley fantastic location for exploring rome. As you go out of the main doors of the hotel turn right and walk about 1min and you will come to the tube station - like the ones in London - Buy your ticket from the machines - 16 euros gives you unlimed use for the week or just buy a daily ticket. You can be at the collesseum in 10 mins. If you arrive in the eve like we did accross the road from the Hotel is shop/cafe. It sells chocolate mainly but you can buy a good coffee, cakes and panini's - you can sit in and eat and the staff are friendly. On the whole its a good European hotel. If your looking for luxury don't stay there but it's a great location!! To be honest it's cost peanuts to stay there and it's perfect as a base camp. Plenty of breakfast if you like croissants. We would all stay there again..even my mother who is fussy!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, below average rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is that it is easily reachable. The metro station is around the corner which itself is only 3 stops from the main station. I give quite a lot of importance on the location because i do not want to walk 30 minutes to the hotel after all-day exhaustion. The rooms are below average for a 3-star. The worst thing was that our room was not very warm. Niether the heater nor the air-conditioner was working well. The water in the bathroom took a lot of time to warm up and the taps made strange musical sounds!! The size of the room was also a downer. Among the positive aspects, the room was equipped with a small fridge and hair dryer. The breakfast was quite fine. We found the staff to be quite friendly, unlike many other reviewers on this site. Next time if I go to Rome, I will book another hotel but at a similar location. However if anyone has already booked this one, I would recommend him to carry on.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 3 Star? Your having a laugh. We were greeted upon arrival by the rudest person I have ever met who gave us no details on Breakfast, Check out times, fire exits, where the room was. He just shoved a key at us. So when we found the room it hadn't been cleaned at all. I stayed with the luggage in the room whilst my partner went back down to sort it out. Whilst I was waiting, I had a look around the room. The wallpaper was going mouldy, the bathroom was shabby, and bed was horrible. The second room we were given was no better. Our stay in Rome was brilliant, but nearly ruined by this place. We tried to be as friendly as possible but the staff in there were so rude, by the last day we were fed up and just started ignoring them. I would strongly recommend against booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect on a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel San Giusto this September. The Hotel is basic, clean and perfect for doing Rome on a budget. The staff are exceptionally friendly, even putting up with my terrible Italian!! Its close to a Metro Station which is a really convenient and cheap way to travel around the city. (Weekly unlimited ticket is only 16 euro) There is also a fantastic restaurant just around the corner, and plenty of shops in the area. The rooms are a little on the small side, but very well kept and air conditioned. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation, first class as long as you know what your getting.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the beginning of september, a bargain at £40 a night for a double room! Hotel is in a very good location, friendly helpful staff. However, on arrival we were 'greeted' by a rude unhelpful member of staff on reception and entered our room to find a maid smoking & watching tv! Its a shame as apart from our arrival, the rest of our stay was very enjoyable and of course the rest of the staff were very pleasant. The room was of a good size, although the shower in our bathroom was in a very small unit! The majority of staff had a very good standard of english and the breakfast was a good selection. A good stay overall, however after a long journey a warm welcome and professional service on arrival would have been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Firstly the bad thing the directions we were given were not good, so once off the metro it was more difficult to find than we were led to believe, but this was only because the main entrance does not face the Piazza Bologna. Look for the Pizzeria Caffee and it is next door. (But I wouldn’t recommend using the Pizzeria Caffee). The hotel was lovely and clean, the staff were very pleasant and helpful. It is ideally located next to the Metro so sore feet on the way home don’t have far to go. The breakfast wasn’t brilliant and we were not given any information on times etc, but for a quick snack in the morning before setting off it was fine. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT DEAL”
Reviews.Author: axltope
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 23rd to 26th June We found and excellent deal trough leonardihotels.com, 80€/night double room (king size bed,clean and with airco), including a very good breakfast. It's true that you have to carry your luggage up to 1st floor but this was not a problem for us with light bags. Location is in a quiet area 30 minutes walking from Termini Station but there is a Metro and Bus Stop around the corner., actually the best way to move around Rome it is by bus(very cheap ;-) ), bus line 62 at the corner will take you to Fontana di Trevi in about 12 minutes, ...The Only inconvenient is that bus service finishes at 24:00h

Reviews.Title: “Location, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found a good price through lastminute.com, and the location was excellent for access by public transport (the hotel is right at a Metro station, and on bus lines from major sites including the Vatican). The room was well-fitted out. However, we found that the shower water never got hot, and there was an icy draft in the bathroom (it was winter). Another drawback is that you must carry your luggage up one flight, before getting to the lift! Breakfast was ok but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall a good hotel. Don't expect American luxury in every little item, and you will be just fine. Staff is very accomodating, very friendly, and very helpful in finding your way arround. Rooms are clean and functional, though a bit small. Breakfast buffet (included) is primo - good food. Lots of good sidewalk vendors for shopping, and nearby shops of every type. Enjoy!
